#Text=La La Land receives record-equalling fourteen Oscar nominations ; Hacksaw Ridge gets six
#Text=Wednesday , January 25 , 2017
#Text=Yesterday , La La Land , directed by Damien Chazelle , received a record-equalling fourteen Academy Awards nomination , tied with 1950s movie All About Eve and 1990 's Titanic .
#Text=Mel Gibson 's HackSaw Ridge based on true story bagged six nominations .
#Text=File photo of Oscars ' nominee Ryan Gosling from file .
#Text=Image : Raffi Asdourian ( Flickr ) .
#Text=The movie , featuring Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone , received nominations in all major categories .
#Text=Gosling and Stone received nominations for Best Actor and Actress respectively .

#Text=The other nominations include Best Picture , Director , Cinematography , Costume Design , Film-editing , Original Score , Production Design , Sound Editing , Sound Mixing and Original Screenplay .
#Text=Two songs from the movie , Audition ( The Fools Who Dream ) and City of Stars , received nominations for best original song .
#Text=Lionsgate studio received 26 nominations — more than any other studio .
#Text=Andrew Garfield , who previously starred in The Amazing Spider-Man along with Emma Stone , competes with Gosling for his role in Hacksaw Ridge .

#Text=Based on the true story of US combat medic Desmond Doss , the movie has received six nominations including Best Picture , Actor in Leading Role , Best Director , Film Editing , Sound Editing and Sound Mixing — La La Land also receiving nominations in these categories .
#Text=Lion and Manchester by the Sea also received six nominations .
#Text=Author J.K. Rowling 's screenwriting début Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them starring Eddie Redmayne received two nominations for costume design and production design .
#Text=Redmayne won the award for best actor two years ago for playing Stephen Hawking in The Theory of Everything and was nominated last year for The Danish Girl .
#Text=This year , six black actors received nominations setting a new record .
#Text=The hashtag #OscarsSoWhite was mentioned lot of times on Twitter as no non-white received nominations for the past two years .
#Text=April Reign , creator of the hashtag , said " Everyone is saying the Oscars are more diverse this year .
